Article Title: AAP: Act on Ajay Maken or will push for Congress' ouster from INDIA
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Aam Aadmi Party on Thursday said it would mobilise the constituents of INDIA bloc to get Congress evicted from the grouping if the main opposition party does not take action against its general secretary Ajay Maken, who, the party claimed, had dubbed Arvind Kejriwal anti-national."Ajay Maken has crossed all limits by calling Kejriwal anti-national. Despite campaigning for Congress in past elections, Kejriwal now faces an FIR, though Congress never filed a single FIR against any BJP leader," AAP MP Sanjay Singh told reporters.AAP demanded disciplinary action against Maken and other Congress members within 24 hours and said if no step is taken, it will push for the grand old party's expulsion from the INDIA bloc. "We will ask the other parties in the alliance to remove Congress," Singh said.Taking umbrage at a 'White Paper on Black Deeds of Kejriwal' released by Congress as part of its campaign for the upcoming Delhi assembly polls, Singh said, "We did not say a single word against Congress during the Haryana elections. Yet, Congress seems to be reading out from BJP's script. Its candidates' list looks as if it was finalised at the BJP office," he said.Besides Maken, AAP also targeted Sandeep Dikshit, Congress's candidate against Kejriwal in Gole Market, for targeting AAP instead of focusing on BJP. Congress, however, was not ready to blink. Delhi Congress chief Devendra Yadav said Kejriwal was panicking because he was facing a loss and was to be sent back to jail.
Article Summary: AAP demands disciplinary action against Ajay Maken and other Congress members. If no step is taken, it will push for the grand old party's expulsion from the INDIA bloc. Delhi Congress chief Devendra Yadav said Kejriwal was panicking because he was facing a loss and was to be sent back to jail.

Article Title: Manmohan Singh's demise: Govt to declare 7-day national mourning, Congress cancels meets
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The central govt will declare a seven-day national mourning as a mark of respect to former PM Manmohan Singh who passed away on Thursday night, sources said. His last rites will be conducted with full state honours .The Union Cabinet under PM Narendra Modi will meet on Friday morning and all govt programmes scheduled stand cancelled, they said.The Congress has also as a mark of respect cancelled all its official programmes, including its foundation day celebrations, for the next seven days. "This includes all agitations and outreach programmes. Party programmes will resume on Jan 3, 2025. The party flag will be flown at half mast during this period of mourning," party general secretary K C Venugopal said.
Article Summary: Former PM Manmohan Singh passed away on Thursday night. His last rites will be conducted with full state honours. Union Cabinet under PM Narendra Modi will meet on Friday morning and all govt programmes scheduled stand cancelled. Congress has also as a mark of respect cancelled all its official programmes.

Article Title: Simran Singh, influencer and radio jockey from J&K, dies by suicide in Gurugram
Article Text:
Image credit: Simran Singh's Instagram

NEW DELHI: Simran Singh , a social media influencer and a radio jockey from Jammu and Kashmir died by suicide in Gurugram , the police informed on Thursday.Her body was discovered hanging in her room on Wednesday night. No suicide note was found at the scene, authorities said.The family said that Simran had been dealing with difficulties for a while, which led her to take this step, investigating officer ASI Pradeep Kumar of Sadar Police Station, Gurugram informed.Following a written complaint from the family, action was taken, and the post-mortem was conducted on Thursday morning. The body has been returned to the family, and no case has been filed, he said.Jammu and Kashmir National Conference condoled the demise of Simran. "Dr Farooq Abdullah, President of the JKNC, and Vice President and Chief Minister @OmarAbdullah along with Deputy CM @Surinderch55have expressed profound grief over the tragic & untimely demise of Simran Singh, popularly known as RJ Simran and lovingly referred to as 'Jammu ki Dhadkan,'" it said in a post on X."Dr Farooq Abdullah and Omar Abdullah extended their heartfelt condolences to Simran’s family, friends, and countless fans during this difficult time. They prayed for peace to the departed soul and strength to her loved ones to bear this unimaginable loss," it added.Simran had over six lakh followers on Instagram.
Article Summary: Simran Singh, a social media influencer and a radio jockey from Jammu and Kashmir died by suicide. Her body was discovered hanging in her room on Wednesday night. No suicide note was found at the scene, authorities said. The body has been returned to the family, and no case has been filed.

Article Title: MP to shift 15 tigers to Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Odisha
Article Text: BHOPAL: Nearly five months after National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) granted approval for the translocation of 15 tigers from Madhya Pradesh to Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh and Odisha, the decks are finally cleared for wheels to roll.It would be the biggest relocation of big cats from any one state, though no timeline is fixed yet. Twelve of the animals will be tigresses. MP CM Mohan Yadav on Thursday issued directives for the transfer to enhance tiger conservation efforts across the country.The tigers will be relocated from Bandhavgarh, Pench and Kanha Tiger Reserves. Four tigresses will be sent to Rajasthan, two tigers and six tigresses to Chhattisgarh, and a male tiger and two tigresses will be sent to Odisha. The states that receive tigers will bear the expenses of translocation.
Article Summary: It would be the biggest relocation of big cats from any one state. 12 of the animals will be tigresses. The states that receive tigers will bear the expenses of translocation. The tigers will be relocated from Bandhavgarh, Pench and Kanha Tiger Reserves.

Article Title: MP electricity transmission tower falls, 3 die
Article Text: BHOPAL: Three people lost their lives and eight were critically injured when a 70-foot-high 400KV electricity transmission tower collapsed in Sidhi district of MP on Thursday afternoon. All victims are from West Bengal.According to police, old transmission towers were being replaced and the contract was given to a firm in Bengal. The tower that collapsed was being put up in Aamdad village of Rampur Naikin panchayat, 600km from Bhopal.Around 12.30pm, the tower suddenly crashed to the ground. Other workers and locals rushed to extricate the victims from the twisted jumble of metal. Police took all the victims to hospital.While two of them died on the way to Sanjay Gandhi Medical College in Rewa, 50km from the accident site, a third was declared dead on arrival. tnn
Article Summary: 70-foot-high 400KV electricity transmission tower collapsed in Sidhi district of MP. All victims are from West Bengal. Old transmission towers were being replaced and the contract was given to a firm in Bengal. The tower that collapsed was being put up in Aamdad village of Rampur Naikin panchayat, 600km from Bhopal.

Article Title: Rajasthan tanker crash toll rises to 19
Article Text: The death toll in a tanker-fire incident in Rajasthan has gone up to 19 with another man succumbing to his severe burn injuries at the Sawai Man Singh hospital in Jaipur on Thursday.The hospital superintendent Dr Sushil Bhati informed that one more death was recorded on Thursday, taking the total number of fatalities in the horrific incident to 19."Currently, 11 people are undergoing treatment at the hospital," he said, adding that two or three of them are likely to be discharged on Thursday.
Article Summary: The death toll in a tanker-fire incident in Rajasthan has gone up to 19. Another man succumbing to his severe burn injuries at the Sawai Man Singh hospital in Jaipur on Thursday. 11 people are undergoing treatment at the hospital.

Article Title: Will welcome back Nitish Kumar if he ditches BJP, says Lalu aide
Article Text: PATNA: RJD MLA Bhai Birendra, considered close to party chief Lalu Prasad, said Thursday they "would welcome" Bihar CM Nitish Kumar back if he parted ways with BJP "There is no permanent friend or foe in politics. If Nitish reaches us after snapping the alliance with the communal forces, we will welcome him," Birendra said. His comments came amid an apparent tug-of-war over whether Nitish will be the NDA face in next year's assembly polls. Birendra set the grapevine buzzing by telling reporters to "watch out" for more of the "political games" that Bihar has seen in the past. "Khela hota raha hai aur aage bhi hoga. Dekhte rahiye (state has witnessed political games in the past and they will happen again. Keep watching)."Nitish's JD(U) dismissed the remarks as "nonsense". "RJD has been constantly trying to create confusion among people. There is restlessness within the party after its disastrous performance in the Lok Sabha and assembly bypolls (last month)," said JD(U)'s Neeraj Kumar. BJP s Dilip Jaiswal accused RJD of desperation.
Article Summary: Bhai Birendra, considered close to party chief Lalu Prasad, said they "would welcome" Bihar CM Nitish Kumar back if he parted ways with BJP. His comments came amid an apparent tug-of-war over whether Nitish will be the NDA face in next year's assembly polls. Nitish's JD(U) dismissed the remarks as "nonsense"

Article Title: NDA to put up united front to take on opposition over Ambedkar
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Representatives of National Democratic Alliance (NDA), at their meeting at BJP president J P Nadda's residence, are said to have resolved to present a united front against the opposition's recent criticism on the BR Ambedkar issue.This meeting, held on the birth centenary of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, saw an assembly of key figures including home minister Amit Shah, Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and leaders from various NDA constituents.The row erupted from what Shah described as a "doctored" version of his statement during a recent parliamentary session, which was leveraged by opposition parties to allege disrespect towards the Dalit icon. According to sources, Shah stressed the need for a coherent counter-narrative to dismantle what he termed an attempt by the opposition to create a "fake narrative". He said his statements were misrepresented and were aimed to sow discord and political unrest.A senior party functionary said, "The Ambedkar issue was integral to the discussion. It came up that Congress MPs did not react when Shah, in his speech in RS, made the remark. But later, Congress representative held a meeting where Rahul Gandhi was present and they decided to make the remark an issue to be highlighted. The way things progressed indicates Congress conspired to make Shah's comment an issue only to draw attention."
Article Summary: Representatives of National Democratic Alliance (NDA), at their meeting at BJP president J P Nadda's residence, are said to have resolved to present a united front. The row erupted from what Shah described as a "doctored" version of his statement during a recent parliamentary session.

Article Title: NDA leaders in huddle with eye on Delhi polls, hold talks on ONOE
Article Text: NEW DELHI: NDA leaders gathered at BJP president J P Nadda 's residence on Wednesday on the birth centenary of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee and also discussed upcoming political challenges. The meeting was attended by home minister Amit Shah, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu, JD(U)'s Rajiv Ranjan Singh, Anupriya Patel of Apna Dal (S) and H D Kumaraswamy of JD(S).Also in attendance were Hindustani Awam Morcha (S) leader Jitan Ram Manjhi, Rashtriya Lok Morcha president Upendra Kushwaha and Bharath Dharma Jana Sena's Thushar Vellappally.Although no formal agenda was declared, sources said the assembly election in Delhi was a focal point alongside discussions on good governance, a hallmark of Vajpayee's tenure. The dialogue extended to the 'one nation, one election' proposal, with the first meeting of the parliamentary panel set for Jan 8. "Attended the NDA leaders' meeting in New Delhi today. Under the visionary leadership of PM Narendra Modi, India is achieving unprecedented milestones and has positioned itself as a global superpower," Nadda posted on X.Sanjay Nishad, chief of UP's Nishad Party, described the gathering as "informal" yet key for strategising future polls, highlighting the unity among the alliance members. He said the meeting acknowledged the recent electoral successes in Haryana and Maharashtra.
Article Summary: The meeting was attended by home minister Amit Shah, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu, JD(U)'s Rajiv Ranjan Singh, Anupriya Patel of Apna Dal (S) and H D Kumaraswamy of JD(S) The dialogue extended to the 'one nation, one election' proposal, with the first meeting of the parliamentary panel set for Jan 8.

Article Title: Giriraj Singh demands Bharat Ratna for Nitish Kumar & Naveen Patnaik, evokes surprise
Article Text: PATNA/BEGUSARAI: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar , said to be smarting from home minister Amit Shah's refusal to commit to NDA's chief ministerial choice for next year's poll, received what some see as a placating recommendation for the Bharat Ratna from Union minister and BJP veteran Giriraj Singh on Wednesday.Giriraj, MP from Begusarai, said he was highly impressed with Nitish's performance as CM since returning to the NDA fold and advised young voters to take note of the difference in governance by the BJP-led alliance and the govts RJD led. The statement has drawn surprise, given Singh's history of sharp criticism towards Kumar."Bihar was infamous for jungle raj and decrepit roads, schools, and other institutions until Nitish Kumar took the state to new heights. Such people deserve to be honoured with the Bharat Ratna," Giriraj said on the sidelines of an event to mark the birth anniversary of AB Vajpayee.He named Odisha's former CM Naveen Patnaik as another deserving candidate for India's highest civilian award.
Article Summary: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said to be smarting from home minister Amit Shah's refusal to commit to NDA's chief ministerial choice for next year's poll. Giriraj Singh said he was highly impressed with Nitish's performance as CM since returning to the NDA fold.

Article Title: How search for 2 missing cops using 'phone signal' leads to discovery of 3rd body in Telangana lake; deaths remain mystery
Article Text:
The bodies were discovered near the lake after their mobile signals were tracked, and authorities are investigating whether the deaths were accidents, suicides, or foul play. Post-mortem reports are awaited.

Cops tried to locate SI, woman constable using mobile signals

HYDERABAD: A sub-inspector and a woman constable from separate police stations in Kamareddy district were found dead under mysterious circumstances in a lake in Adloor Yellareddy close to Kamareddy town.Body of a computer operator working in a cooperative society was also found from the lake.District police confirmed that Bhiknoor SI Sai Kumar (30), Bibipet constable Sruthi (32) and computer operator Nikhil (28) had drowned in Pedda Cheruvu.The bodies of Sruthi and Nikhil were found late Wednesday night, while the SI's body was located on Thursday morning.Sai Kumar was married, Sruthi was a divorcee and Nikhil, who belonged to Bibipet, was unmarried. Police, who are examining their call records, found that the three had exchanged calls prior to their disappearance. Sruthi had professional ties to both Sai Kumar and Nikhil, cops said.Authorities are now awaiting the post-mortem reports to determine whether the deaths were accidental or a suicide pact or if there was another reason.On Wednesday, Sruthi had the day off, with her family expecting her to return home by 11 am. But when she didn't return, they tried reaching her by phone.When there was no response, they contacted her colleague, who also could not get in touch with her. Concerned, her family began searching for her, and soon, police learned that two other individuals were also missing.Kamareddy SP Sindhu Sharma said: "It was late on Wednesday evening when we were informed that three individuals were missing. After tracking their mobile phone signals, our team reached the lake and found two pairs of footwear and two mobile phones by its shore."With the help of expert swimmers and fire department officials, the bodies of Sruthi and Nikhil were recovered late on Wednesday night. "The SI's mobile phone and car were also found at the lake," a cop said.As of Thursday evening, the cause of death remained a mystery.On Wednesday, Sruthi had the day off, with her family expecting her to return home by 11 am. But when she didn't return, they tried reaching her by phone.When there was no response, they contacted her colleague, who also could not get in touch with her. Concerned, her family began searching for her, and soon, police learned that two other individuals were also missing.Kamareddy SP Sindhu Sharma said: "It was late on Wednesday evening when we were informed that three individuals were missing. After tracking their mobile phone signals, our team reached the lake and found two pairs of footwear and two mobile phones by its shore."With the help of expert swimmers and fire department officials, the bodies of Sruthi and Nikhil were recovered late on Wednesday night. "The SI's mobile phone and car were also found at the lake," a cop said.As of Thursday evening, the cause of death remained a mystery.
Article Summary: Bodies of Bhiknoor SI Sai Kumar (30), Bibipet constable Sruthi (32) and computer operator Nikhil (28) had drowned in Pedda Cheruvu. Authorities are investigating whether the deaths were accidents, suicides, or foul play. Post-mortem reports are awaited.

Article Title: Last appeal to Punjab: Manmohan Singh sought unity, progress
Article Text:
The economist-politician with former Punjab CMs Parkash Singh Badal and Capt Amarinder Singh

Phir uthi akhir sada touheed ki Punjab se, Marde-kaamil ne jagya Hind to Phir khwaab se.

CHANDIGARH: In his final direct message to the people of Punjab , former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh made an impassioned appeal, urging voters to defend the nation’s democratic ideals and uphold the sanctity of the Constitution . The heartfelt letter, written during the Lok Sabha elections , showcased his deep connection to his home state and his concern for the challenges it faces.Dr Singh began by addressing Punjabis as “warriors” and criticised the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for allegedly targeting “Punjab, Punjabis, and Punjabiyat”. He spoke of the sacrifices made by the state’s farmers, highlighting the death of 750 farmers, most of whom hailed from Punjab, during the monthslong protests at Delhi’s borders.Taking aim at Prime Minister Narendra Modi , Dr Singh pointed out the unfulfilled promise of doubling farmers’ incomes by 2022. He accused the BJP-led govt of implementing policies that, over the past decade, eroded farmers’ earnings. In contrast, he recalled the achievements of his govt, including a Rs 72,000 crore loan waiver for 3.73 crore farmers, increased minimum support prices (MSP), and ex panded agricultural production and exports.Dr Singh’s letter also highlighted the Congress-UPA govt’s contributions to Punjab’s development. He cited major initiatives such as the Amritsar-Kolkata Industrial Corridor , now part of the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor, which passes through Amritsar, Jalandhar, and Ludhiana. He mentioned landmark projects like the oil refinery in Bathinda (2011), IIT Ropar (2008), National Law University in Patiala (2006), and the Shaheed Bhagat Singh Memorial at Khatkar Kalan.The govt also provided funds for the development of Talwandi Sabo and Anandpur Sahib during the tercentenary celebrations of Guru Granth Sahib’s Gurta Gaddi. He expressed concern over the current state of politics, accusing the ruling party of fostering discord and dehumanisation.He called on the people of Punjab to counter these forces by voting for unity, peace, and progress. “With folded hands, I appeal to each one of you to give love, peace, fraternity, and harmony a chance in India,” he wrote.He urged youth to exercise caution and vote for a brighter, inclusive future. He ended his appeal with a couplet by Allama Iqbal: “
Article Summary: Dr Singh began by addressing Punjabis as ‘warriors’ and criticised the Bharatiya Janata Party. He spoke of the sacrifices made by the state’s farmers. He expressed concern over the current state of politics, accusing the ruling party of fostering discord.
